{{More footnotes|date=January 2010}} {{Bare links|date=June 2011}} '''SlySoft Inc.''' is a [[software]] company located in [[St. John's, Antigua and Barbuda|St. John's]], [[Antigua and Barbuda]]. Its products consist of software to back up and convert digital media, including [[CD]]s, [[DVD]]s, [[HD DVD]]s, and [[Blu-ray Disc]]s, as well as copy and back up optical media and render PC-based games playable without the disc.
==Products==
* [[AnyDVD]] to remove/disable [[Digital rights management|DRM]] restrictions and user prohibited operations on DVD films, and to fix structure protections and mastering errors * [[AnyDVD HD]] - to remove DRM, lock-outs, and [[User operation prohibition|UOP]]s on DVD films and additionally High Definition media, specifically Blu-ray Disc and HD DVD * [[CloneCD]] - to copy [[optical disc]]s in raw format * [[CloneDVD]] - to copy non-DRM DVD movies to the hard disk or Single or Dual-Layer DVD blanks (sold also by [[Elaborate Bytes AG]]) * CloneDVD mobile - to convert DVD files to mobile video players like the [[iPod]] or the [[PlayStation Portable]]<ref>[http://www.slysoft.com/en/clonedvd-mobile.html Clone DVD mobile]</ref> * [[Game Jackal]] - to create CD profiles so a disc isn't required when starting the game * Game Jackal Enterprise - extended version of [[Game Jackal]] with additional features such as automatic distribution of game profiles to client machines<ref>[http://www.slysoft.com/en/gamejackal-enterprise.html Game Jackal Enterprise]</ref> * Virtual CloneDrive is a [[disk image emulator]]. It is designed for mounting images created by the SlySoft programs [[CloneCD]] (.CCD files) and [[AnyDVD HD]] (*.ISO files), it can also mount BIN formats.<ref>[http://www.slysoft.com/en/virtual-clonedrive.html Virtual CloneDrive]</ref>
==AACS and BD+== SlySoft was the first to offer [[Advanced Access Content System|AACS]] circumvention that worked for any disc available; previous programs only cracked "compatible" discs using a database of known keys.
On November 8, 2007, SlySoft claimed to have completely cracked [[BD+]]. However, this turned out to be incorrect, as subsequent versions of BD+ security code have caused SlySoft to re-design its software. On March 3, 2008, SlySoft updated AnyDVD HD allowing the full decryption of BD+,<ref>[http://forum.slysoft.com/showthread.php?t=14786 SlySoft Press Release]</ref> allowing for not only the viewing of the film itself but also playing and copying disks with third-party software. A third iteration of BD+ was released in November 2008, and was announced to be cracked by SlySoft with the release of AnyDVD HD 6.5.0.2 on December 29, 2008.<ref>[http://forum.slysoft.com/showthread.php?t=24602 SlySoft defeats Blu-ray's BD+ DRM scheme again]</ref> A fourth version of BD+ security code was discovered with the movie [[Australia (2008 film)|Australia]] on February 17, 2009, thwarting the effectiveness of SlySoft's software.<ref>[http://forum.slysoft.com/showthread.php?t=27330 BD+ discs that may not work properly with AnyDVD HD]</ref><ref>[http://www.afterdawn.com/news/archive/16313.cfm BD+ re-secured, SlySoft beaten]</ref>
However on March 19, 2009, SlySoft updated AnyDVD HD to version 6.5.3.1 which allowed the decryption of the new version of BD+ used by the movie [[Australia (2008 film)|Australia]].<ref>[http://www.slysoft.com/download/changes_anydvd.txt AnyDVD Version Change Log]</ref>
== Licensing ==
On December 1, 2008 SlySoft announced it would for the first time begin charging its customers for updates to its software.<ref>[http://forum.slysoft.com/showthread.php?t=23279 Press release: SlySoft announces new update policy]</ref>
In November 2010, SlySoft initially announced the discontinuation of the lifetime licensing option beginning January 2011. An e-mail<ref>[http://www.mediasmartserver.net/2010/11/26/slysoft-to-discontinue-lifetime-subscriptions-for-anydvd/ Original text of the announcement]</ref> announcing the change ahead of time was sent to all registered customers allowing everyone the chance to purchase the lifetime option "while it is still possible;" and the notice was posted to their official forums. In January 2011, all announcements regarding the change were deleted without comment and a new structured licensing plan was put into place; including the lifetime licensing option at the highest priced tier. The new 'update service' will block free updates without the lifetime licence, but the current paid non-lifetime software licences will continue to work, sans-update, indefinitely.
